page.title: 02DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: Our area was mostly farmland. We spotted wheat, barley and potatoes being grown.Many of the fields were grass, for animal fodder.Most of the grain growing land was owned by the Cannon Hall estate. The numerous other farms were on a much smaller scale. They ranged from about 2O acres to 4O acres. Some farmers rented more fields from Cannon Hall estate when they were needed. Nearly all were mixed farms with a number of dairy cows, chickens and goats. There were quite a few woodland areas which were mainly deciduous and unmanaged. There were a number of small streams running through the area and half a dozen springs also in evidence. Many farms farms had wells from these, though few were in use. Two disused mills and millponds were found at Gunthwaite and Cawthorne.
